p: For most of the tested hydrolates H HD and H SD, no antimicrobial activity against the observed microorganisms was recorded. For this reason, the data are not presented in the form of a table. Most of the studied arcobacters were not suppressed by non-concentrated hydrolates at all. However, a very weak antimicrobial activity of clove hydrolate was reported just against A. thereius LMG 24488 (H HD, inhibition zone 6.5 ± 0.3 mm; H SD, inhibition zone 6.8 ± 0.4 mm). None of the tested arcobacters were suppressed by the hydrolates obtained by the distillation of lavender, fennel and laurel.
